sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: द्वितीयोऽध्यायः अथातोऽपामार्गतण्डुलीयमध्यायं व्याख्यास्यामः
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: dvitīyo'dhyāyaḥ athāto'pāmārgataṇḍulīyamadhyāyaṃ vyākhyāsyāmaḥ
sanskrit_verses.translation: CHAPTER TWO Let us now explain the chapter on the rice of the waterway

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: इति ह स्माह भगवानात्रेयः
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: iti ha smāha bhagavānātreyaḥ
sanskrit_verses.translation: This is what the Lord Atreyu said to us

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: अपामार्गस्य बीजानि पिप्पलीमरिचानि च । विडङ्गान्यथ शिश्रूणि सर्षपांस्तुम्बुरूणि च
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: apāmārgasya bījāni pippalīmaricāni ca | viḍaṅgānyatha śiśrūṇi sarṣapāṃstumburūṇi ca
sanskrit_verses.translation: The seeds of the waterway are figs and peppers. They also brought vidangas, shishuras, mustard seeds and tumburus

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: अजाजीं चाजगन्यां च पीलून्येलां हरेणुकाम् । पृथ्वीकां सुरसां श्वेतां कुठेरकफणिज्झकौ
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: ajājīṃ cājaganyāṃ ca pīlūnyelāṃ hareṇukām | pṛthvīkāṃ surasāṃ śvetāṃ kuṭherakaphaṇijjhakau
sanskrit_verses.translation: They also gave birth to Ajaji, Ajaganya, Pīlūnyela and Harenuka. The earth, the wine, the white, the pot, the tail, and the tail

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: शिरीषबीजं लशुनं हरिद्रे लवणद्वयम् । ज्योतिष्मतीं नागरं च दद्याच्छीर्षविरेचने
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: śirīṣabījaṃ laśunaṃ haridre lavaṇadvayam | jyotiṣmatīṃ nāgaraṃ ca dadyācchīrṣavirecane
sanskrit_verses.translation: Shirīṣa seeds, garlic, green tea and two salt. Jyotishmati and citrus should be given for headache

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: गौरवे शिरसः शूले पीनसेऽर्धावभेदके । क्रिमिव्याधावपस्मारे घ्राणनाशे प्रमोहके
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: gaurave śirasaḥ śūle pīnase'rdhāvabhedake | krimivyādhāvapasmāre ghrāṇanāśe pramohake
sanskrit_verses.translation: In dignity, in the head, in the spear, in the thickness, in the half-breaker. In worm disease, forgetfulness, loss of smell, and delusion

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: मदनं मधुकं निम्बं जीमूतं कृतवेधनम् । पिप्पली कुटजेक्ष्वाकूण्येलां धामार्गवाणि च
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: madanaṃ madhukaṃ nimbaṃ jīmūtaṃ kṛtavedhanam | pippalī kuṭajekṣvākūṇyelāṃ dhāmārgavāṇi ca
sanskrit_verses.translation: Madana, honey, lemon, cloud, and piercing. Figs, kutaja, kshvakun, yela and dhamargavani

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: उपस्थिते श्लेष्मपित्ते व्याधावामाशयाश्रये । वमनार्थं प्रयुञ्जीत भिषग्देहमदूषयन्
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: upasthite śleṣmapitte vyādhāvāmāśayāśraye | vamanārthaṃ prayuñjīta bhiṣagdehamadūṣayan
sanskrit_verses.translation: When mucus and bile are present, the disease is caused by the left stomach. Use it for vomiting, contaminating the physician's body

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: त्रिवृतां त्रिफलां दन्तीं नीलिकां सप्तलां वचाम् । कम्पिल्लकं गवाक्षीं च क्षीरिणीमुदकीर्यकाम् ।। ९ । पीलून्यारग्वधं द्राक्षां द्रवन्तीं निचुलानि च । पक्वाशयगते दोषे विरेकार्थं प्रयोजयेत्
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: trivṛtāṃ triphalāṃ dantīṃ nīlikāṃ saptalāṃ vacām | kampillakaṃ gavākṣīṃ ca kṣīriṇīmudakīryakām || 9 | pīlūnyāragvadhaṃ drākṣāṃ dravantīṃ niculāni ca | pakvāśayagate doṣe virekārthaṃ prayojayet
sanskrit_verses.translation: The three-fold, three-fruited tooth is blue and the skin is seven. Kampillaka and Gavakshi are the milky and water-soaked trees. 9. They killed the yellow snakes, and the grapes were melting. It should be used for diarrhea in case of defects in the stomach

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: पाटलां चाग्निमन्थं च बिल्वं श्योनाकमेव च । काश्मर्यं शालपर्णी च पृश्निपर्णी निदिग्धिकाम्
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: pāṭalāṃ cāgnimanthaṃ ca bilvaṃ śyonākameva ca | kāśmaryaṃ śālaparṇī ca pṛśniparṇī nidigdhikām
sanskrit_verses.translation: They also grew pātala, agnimantha, bilva and śyonaka trees. Kashmarya, Shalaparni, Prishniparni and Nidigdhika

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: बलां श्वदंषां बृहतीमेरण्डं सपुनर्नवम् । यवान् कुलत्थान् कोलानि गुडूचीं मदनानि च
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: balāṃ śvadaṃṣāṃ bṛhatīmeraṇḍaṃ sapunarnavam | yavān kulatthān kolāni guḍūcīṃ madanāni ca
sanskrit_verses.translation: The strong dog-toothed Bṛhatī Meranda was again fresh. Barley, kulatthan, cola, guduchi and madan

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: पलाशं कत्तृणं चैव स्नेहांश्च लवणानि च । उदावर्ते विबन्धेषु युञ्ज्यादास्थापनेषु च
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: palāśaṃ kattṛṇaṃ caiva snehāṃśca lavaṇāni ca | udāvarte vibandheṣu yuñjyādāsthāpaneṣu ca
sanskrit_verses.translation: They also used lotus flowers, grass, oils and salt. In the udavarta, in the obstacles, and in the installations of the yunyada

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: अत एवौषधगणात् संकल्प्यमनुवासनम् । मारुतघ्नमिति प्रोक्तः संग्रहः पाञ्चकर्मिकः
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: ata evauṣadhagaṇāt saṃkalpyamanuvāsanam | mārutaghnamiti proktaḥ saṃgrahaḥ pāñcakarmikaḥ
sanskrit_verses.translation: That is why it is necessary to smell the perfume from the herbs. The collection called Marutaghna is five-fold

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: तान्युपस्थितदोषाणां स्नेहस्वेदोपपादनैः । पञ्च कर्माणि कुर्वीत मात्राकालौ विचारयन्
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: tānyupasthitadoṣāṇāṃ snehasvedopapādanaiḥ | pañca karmāṇi kurvīta mātrākālau vicārayan
sanskrit_verses.translation: They are caused by the oil and sweat of the faults that have arisen. One should perform five actions considering the quantity and time

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: मात्राकालाश्रया युक्तिः सिद्धिर्युक्तौ प्रतिष्ठिता । तिष्ठत्युपरि युक्तिज्ञो द्रव्यज्ञानवतां सदा
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: mātrākālāśrayā yuktiḥ siddhiryuktau pratiṣṭhitā | tiṣṭhatyupari yuktijño dravyajñānavatāṃ sadā
sanskrit_verses.translation: Logic depends on quantity and time, and perfection is established in logic. The logician always stands above those who have knowledge of matter

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: अत ऊर्ध्वं प्रवक्ष्यामि यवागूर्विविधौषधाः । विविधानां विकाराणां तत्साध्यानां निवृत्तये
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: ata ūrdhvaṃ pravakṣyāmi yavāgūrvividhauṣadhāḥ | vividhānāṃ vikārāṇāṃ tatsādhyānāṃ nivṛttaye
sanskrit_verses.translation: Below I shall describe the various medicinal properties of barley and oil. To relieve the various transformations that are achievable by it

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: लिए पिप्पलीपिप्पलीमूलचव्यचित्रकनागरैः । यवागूर्दीपनीया स्याच्छूलघ्नी चोपसाधिता
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: lie pippalīpippalīmūlacavyacitrakanāgaraiḥ | yavāgūrdīpanīyā syācchūlaghnī copasādhitā
sanskrit_verses.translation: Lie figs, figs, roots, chavya, chitra, and citrus. Barley powder is to be burned and prepared for the killing of thorns

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: दधित्थबिल्वचाङ्गेरीतक्रदाडिमसाधिता । पाचनी ग्राहिणी पेया सवाते पाञ्चमूलिकी
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: dadhitthabilvacāṅgerītakradāḍimasādhitā | pācanī grāhiṇī peyā savāte pāñcamūlikī
sanskrit_verses.translation: It is made with curd, bilva, cāṅgerita, cradle and pomegranate. Digestive receptive drink Savate five-rooted

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: शालपर्णीबलाबिल्वैः पृश्निपर्ण्या च साधिता । दाडिमाम्ला हिता पेया पित्तश्लेष्मातिसारिणाम्
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: śālaparṇībalābilvaiḥ pṛśniparṇyā ca sādhitā | dāḍimāmlā hitā peyā pittaśleṣmātisāriṇām
sanskrit_verses.translation: It was prepared with śālaparṇī, balabilva and pṛśniparṇya. Pomegranate juice is a good drink for those who are excessive in bile and mucus

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: पयस्यर्धोदके च्छागे हीबेरोत्पलनागरैः । पेया रक्तातिसारघ्नी पृश्निपर्ण्या च साधिता ।। २१ । । दद्यात् सातिविषां पेयां सामे साम्लां सनागराम् । श्वदंष्ट्राकण्टकारीभ्यां मूत्रकृच्छ्रे सफाणिताम्
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: payasyardhodake cchāge hīberotpalanāgaraiḥ | peyā raktātisāraghnī pṛśniparṇyā ca sādhitā || 21 | | dadyāt sātiviṣāṃ peyāṃ sāme sāmlāṃ sanāgarām | śvadaṃṣṭrākaṇṭakārībhyāṃ mūtrakṛcchre saphāṇitām
sanskrit_verses.translation: In a cover of half a cup of milk, add hiber, lily and citrus. The drink is made from red diarrhea and is made from the leaves of the tail. 21 . . Give him a drink of seven poisons, a mixture of salt and cinnamon. She was struck by the dog's teeth and thorns in her urinary difficulties

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: विडङ्गपिप्पलीमूलशिग्रुभिर्मरिचेन च । तक्रसिद्धा यवागूः स्यात् क्रिमिघ्नी ससुवर्चिका
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: viḍaṅgapippalīmūlaśigrubhirmaricena ca | takrasiddhā yavāgūḥ syāt krimighnī sasuvarcikā
sanskrit_verses.translation: Viḍaṅga, figs, roots, shigru and chillies are also added. Takrasiddha barley is a worm-killer with a good taste

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: मृद्वीकासारिवालाजपिप्पलोमधुनागरैः । पिपासाघ्नी विषघ्नी च सोमराजीविपाचिता
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: mṛdvīkāsārivālājapippalomadhunāgaraiḥ | pipāsāghnī viṣaghnī ca somarājīvipācitā
sanskrit_verses.translation: They are made of clay, beetroot, vinegar, fig tree, honey and cinnamon. It is thirst quenching and poisonous and is digested by Somaraji

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: सिद्धा वराहनिर्यूहे यवागूबृंहणी मता । गवेधुकानां भृष्टानां कर्शनीया समाक्षिका
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: siddhā varāhaniryūhe yavāgūbṛṃhaṇī matā | gavedhukānāṃ bhṛṣṭānāṃ karśanīyā samākṣikā
sanskrit_verses.translation: Siddha is considered to be the barley-cow in the herd of boars. The cow's milk is a slim mixture of roasted cow's milk

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: सर्पिष्मती बहुतिला स्नेहनी लवणान्विता । कुशामलकनिर्यूहे श्यामाकानां विरूक्षणी
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: sarpiṣmatī bahutilā snehanī lavaṇānvitā | kuśāmalakaniryūhe śyāmākānāṃ virūkṣaṇī
sanskrit_verses.translation: It is very buttery, greasy and salty. Kushamala niryuhe shyamakas virukshani

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: दशमूलीशृता कासहिक्काश्वासकफापहा । यमके मदिरासिद्धा पक्वाशयरुजापहा
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: daśamūlīśṛtā kāsahikkāśvāsakaphāpahā | yamake madirāsiddhā pakvāśayarujāpahā
sanskrit_verses.translation: Dashamulishrita kashikkaswaskafapaha. Yamake Madirasiddha Pakvashayrujapaha

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: शाकैर्मासैस्तिलैर्माषैः सिद्धा वर्चो निरस्यति । जम्ब्वाम्रास्थिदधित्थाम्लबिल्वैः । साङ्ग्राहिकी मता
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: śākairmāsaistilairmāṣaiḥ siddhā varco nirasyati | jambvāmrāsthidadhitthāmlabilvaiḥ | sāṅgrāhikī matā
sanskrit_verses.translation: Siddha varcha is removed by vegetables, sesame seeds and meat. Jambva, mango, bone, yogurt, acid and bilva. Collective opinion

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: क्षारचित्रकहिङ्ग्वम्लवेतसैर्भेदिनी मता । अभयापिप्पलीमूलविश्वैर्वातानुलोमनी
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: kṣāracitrakahiṅgvamlavetasairbhedinī matā | abhayāpippalīmūlaviśvairvātānulomanī
sanskrit_verses.translation: It is considered to be a piercing agent with salt, citrus, ginger, acid and vinegar. Abhayapippalimulvisvairvatanulomani

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: तक्रसिद्धा यवागूः स्याद् घृतव्यापत्तिनाशिनी । तैलव्यापदि शस्ता स्यात्तक्रपिण्याकसाधिता
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: takrasiddhā yavāgūḥ syād ghṛtavyāpattināśinī | tailavyāpadi śastā syāttakrapiṇyākasādhitā
sanskrit_verses.translation: Barley cow’s milk made from takra is used to destroy the trouble of ghee. It is suitable for oil distress and is prepared with sugarcane juice

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: गव्यमांसरसैः साम्ला विषमज्वरनाशिनी । कण्ठ्या यवानां यमके पिप्पल्यामलकैः शृता
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: gavyamāṃsarasaiḥ sāmlā viṣamajvaranāśinī | kaṇṭhyā yavānāṃ yamake pippalyāmalakaiḥ śṛtā
sanskrit_verses.translation: Samla with cow meat juice is a poisonous fever reliever. The neck of the barley is salted with fig and amalaka in the yam

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: ताम्रचूडरसे सिद्धा रेतोमार्गरुजापहा । समाषविदला वृष्या घृतक्षीरोपसाधिता
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: tāmracūḍarase siddhā retomārgarujāpahā | samāṣavidalā vṛṣyā ghṛtakṣīropasādhitā
sanskrit_verses.translation: Tamrachudarase is perfect for relieving pain in the semen tract. The testicles are covered with butter and milk

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: उपोदिकादधिभ्यां तु सिद्धा मदविनाशिनी । क्षुधं हन्यादपामार्गक्षीरगोधारसैः शृता
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: upodikādadhibhyāṃ tu siddhā madavināśinī | kṣudhaṃ hanyādapāmārgakṣīragodhārasaiḥ śṛtā
sanskrit_verses.translation: It is perfectly destroyer of intoxication by the use of upodika and yogurt. It kills hunger and is salted with water, milk and cow's milk

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: तत्र श्लोकः अष्टाविंशतिरित्येता यवाग्वः परिकीर्तिताः । पञ्च कर्माणि चाश्रित्य प्रोक्तो भैषज्यसंग्रहः
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: tatra ślokaḥ aṣṭāviṃśatirityetā yavāgvaḥ parikīrtitāḥ | pañca karmāṇi cāśritya prokto bhaiṣajyasaṃgrahaḥ
sanskrit_verses.translation: There are twenty-eight verses in this chapter, and these barley grains are described. The collection of medicines is said to be based on the five actions

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: पूर्वं मूलफलज्ञानहेतोरुक्तं यदौषधम् । पञ्चकर्माश्रयज्ञानहेतोस्तत् कीर्तितं पुनः
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: pūrvaṃ mūlaphalajñānahetoruktaṃ yadauṣadham | pañcakarmāśrayajñānahetostat kīrtitaṃ punaḥ
sanskrit_verses.translation: The medicine which I have previously described for the purpose of knowing the roots and fruits. That is again mentioned for the sake of knowledge dependent on the five actions

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: स्मृतिमान् हेतुयुक्तिज्ञो जितात्मा प्रतिपत्तिमान् । भिषगौषधसंयोगैश्चिकित्सां कर्तुमर्हति
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: smṛtimān hetuyuktijño jitātmā pratipattimān | bhiṣagauṣadhasaṃyogaiścikitsāṃ kartumarhati
sanskrit_verses.translation: He remembers, he knows reason and logic, he has conquered his mind and he is able to reason. It can be treated with combinations of medicines and herbs

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: इत्यग्निवेशकृते तन्त्रे चरकप्रतिसंस्कृते श्लोकस्थानेऽपामार्गतण्डुलीयो नाम द्वितीयोऽध्यायः
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: ityagniveśakṛte tantre carakapratisaṃskṛte ślokasthāne'pāmārgataṇḍulīyo nāma dvitīyo'dhyāyaḥ
sanskrit_verses.translation: This is the second chapter of the Tantra composed by Agnivesh, revised by Charaka, in the place of the verse, entitled Apamargatanduliya

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: क
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: ka
sanskrit_verses.translation: K
